answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of leaseback projects which may be helpful as a start.
It seems to be a common practice for school districts and I have included three of those examples below.
Menlo Park, CA
http://district.mpcsd.org/modules/groups/homepagefiles/cms/1602720/File/RFQ%20HV%20Lease-Leaseback/Request%20for%20Qualifications-Hillview%20MS.pdf
Chula Vista, CA
http://www.buildingpropo.com/documents/MOH_RFP_LLB_RFP_RFQ.pdf
San Bernardino, CA
http://www.sbcusdfacilities.com/uploads/rfp/RFP83_Lease_LeaseBack_Construction_Services_RFQ.pdf
I also included a PM article entitled Raising Local Capital through Sale-Leasebacks.
http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9107/public/pmplus1.cfm?author=Ronald%20Pollina&title=Raising%20Local%20Capital%20through%20Sale-Leasebacks
Snoqualmie City, WA used a lease-leaseback agreement to build the Snoqualmie Community Center.
http://www.ci.snoqualmie.wa.us/DesktopModules/Bring2mind/DMX/Download.aspx?Command=Core_Download&EntryId=14033&PortalId=0&TabId=273
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Eugene Smith
text: Can anyone provide references to/for a private sector developer who has successfully engaged in a lease back financing strategy for the construction od public buildings?
title: Financing of Public Buildings
